page.title: 03Farming in Blithfield
page.content: 13 Farmers work this area most farms being of 50-60 acres, 4 are 200-300 acres and 1 of 400 acres. All own their farms but 3 rent land from the water board near the resevoir. In recent years land has been sold off on retirement of the farmers and other rents his land to 3 seperate farmers. Most farms are self sufficient with machinery owning on average 2-4 tractors of 40-80hp. There are 4 combine harvesters over the whole plot, with a 14ft cut contractors may be called in to assist with some silage making. The soil is heavy to the south of the resevoir but light to gravelly to the west. Sprays are used on the crops to guard against rust, mildew and aphids. Grass is treated with fertilisers during the spring and summer and with manure in autumn and winter.
